    public class ListTableModel
extends javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListTableModel

        public ListTableModel(int columns)
        Constructs an empty ListTableModel with default column names for the specified number of columns.
        Parameters:
        columns - the number of columns the table holds

      • ListTableModel

        public ListTableModel(java.util.List<java.lang.String> columnNames)
        Constructs an empty ListTableModel with customized column names. The number of columns is determined bye the number of items in the columnNames List.
        Parameters:
        columnNames - List containing the names of the new columns

      • ListTableModel

        public ListTableModel(int rows,
              int columns)
        Constructs a ListTableModel with the specified number of rows. Default column names will be used for the specified number of columns.
        Parameters:
        rows - the number of initially empty rows to create
        columns - the number of columns the table holds

      • ListTableModel

        public ListTableModel(java.util.List<java.util.List> modelData,
              java.util.List<java.lang.String> columnNames)
        Constructs a ListTableModel with initial data and customized column names. Each item in the modelData List must also be a List Object containing items for each column of the row. Each column's name will be taken from the columnNames List and the number of colums is determined by thenumber of items in the columnNames List.
        Parameters:
        modelData - the data of the table
        columnNames - List containing the names of the new columns

        public static ListTableModel createModelFromResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Create a ListTableModel given a specific ResultSet. The column names and class type will be retrieved from the ResultSetMetaData. The data is retrieved from each row found in the ResultSet. The class of
        Parameters:
        resultSet - ResultSet containing results of a database query
        Returns:
        a newly created ListTableModel
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when an SQL error is encountered

      • moveRow

        public void moveRow(int start,
           int end,
           int to)
        Moves one or more rows from the inlcusive range start to end to the to position in the model. After the move, the row that was at index start will be at index to. This method will send a tableRowsUpdated notification message to all the listeners. 

          Examples of moves:
  
        
  1. moveRow(1,3,5);
                  a|B|C|D|e|f|g|h|i|j|k   - before
                  a|e|f|g|h|B|C|D|i|j|k   - after
  
        
  2. moveRow(6,7,1);
                  a|b|c|d|e|f|G|H|i|j|k   - before
                  a|G|H|b|c|d|e|f|i|j|k   - after
        Parameters:
        start - the starting row index to be moved
        end - the ending row index to be moved
        to - the destination of the rows to be moved
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the elements would be moved out of the table's range

      • removeRowRange

        public void removeRowRange(int start,
                  int end)
        Remove the specified rows from the model. Rows between the starting and ending indexes, inclusively, will be removed. Notification of the rows being removed will be generated.
        Parameters:
        start - starting row index
        end - ending row index
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any row index is invalid

      • removeRows

        public void removeRows(int... rows)
        Remove the specified rows from the model. The row indexes in the array must be in increasing order. Notification of the rows being removed will be generated.
        Parameters:
        rows - array containing indexes of rows to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any row index is invalid

      • replaceRow

        public void replaceRow(int row,
              T rowData)
        Replace a row of data at the row location in the model. Notification of the row being replaced will be generated.
        Parameters:
        row - row in the model where the data will be replaced
        rowData - data of the row to replace the existing data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the Class of the row data does not match the row Class of the model.

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        public void setModelEditable(boolean isModelEditable)
        Set the ability to edit cell data for the entire model Note: values set by the setColumnEditable(...) method will have prioritiy over this value.
        Parameters:
        isModelEditable - true/false
